Faith D. Ottery. Assessment and interventional pathways in oncology. Nutrition, 12, n.1, 1996.
Nayara de Souza Gomes, Regiane Maio. Patient-generated subjective Global Assessment ans Nutritional Risk Indicators in Oncology Patients Receiving Chemotherapy. Revista Brasileira de Cancerologia, 2015; 61 (3):235-242.
Vázquez de la Torre MJ, Stein K, Vásquez Garibay EM, Kumazawa Ichikawa MR, Troyo Sanromán R, Salcedo Flores AG, Sánchez Zubieta FA. Patient-generated subjective Global Assessment of Nutritional status in pediatric patients with recent cancer diagnosis. Nutr Hospi, 2017, 24;34(5):1050-1058.

details.purpose: PG-SGA is a screening tool for early detection of nutrition risk and malnutrition.
details.use:
To be used in oncologic patients;
to be used in adults and children;

items.items: Patient generated subjective global assessement of nutritional status
Screening tool for malnutrition in cancer patients
In summary of my current ans recent weight:
A year ago I weighed about:
Six months ago I weighed about:
During the past two weeks my weight has:
As compared to my normal, I would rate my food intake during the past month as either:
I have had the following problmes that kept me from eating enough (check all that apply):
no appetite, just did not feel like eating
no appetite, just did not feel like eating
things taste funny or have no taste
things taste funny or have no taste
If the patient marked pain, he should describe where.
if the patiente marked "other", he should describe it.
Over the past, I would rate my activity as generally:
not my normal self, but able to be up and about with fairly normal activies.
not my normal self, but able to be up and about with fairly normal activies.
not feeling up to most things , but in bed less than half the day.
not feeling up to most things , but in bed less than half the day
able to do little activity and spend mots of the day in bed or chair.
able to do little activity and spend mots of the day in bed or chair.
pretty much bedridden, rarely out of bed
pretty much bedridden, rarely out of bed
5. Disease and its relation to Nutitional Requirements
The remainder of this form will be completed by your doctor, nurse, or therapist. thank you.
For each trait specify: 0= normal, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate; 3 = severe
For each trait specify: 0= normal, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate; 3 = severe
For each trait specify: 0= normal, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate; 3 = severe
For each trait specify: 0= normal, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate; 3 = severe
B = moderately (or suspected of being) malnourished
B = moderately (or suspected of being) malnourished
